result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Robert Wohlwend was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Emergency 9-1-1 call, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 256.35(10)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Robert Wohlwend

records.addlTxt:
8:30 AM Defendant Charles Robert Wohlwend in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites agreement that defendant to plead to sole count. A fine of $250 plus court costs and 17 days jail with credit for 13 days, time served. Defendant pleads guilty. . Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.

Court orders a fine of $250 plus court costs and serve 17 days jail with credit for 13 days, time served.

2:08 PM Defendant Charles Robert Wohlwend in court.  Attorney Mark Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. State indicates that the defendant missed a jury pretrial conference and the jury trial must now be reset. Defendant indicates that he missed jury pretrial court appearance due to illness. State asks for $600 cash bail and indicates concerns over missed appearance while out on signature bond. Court also indicates concerns over missed appearance. Asks the defendant if he can post any amount. Defendant indicates that he has been ill and cannot post any amount. Court order $600 cash bail and vacates the order of bail/bond forfeiture.
Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:31 AM Defendant Charles Robert Wohlwend not in court.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State requests warrant, remove trial
Court orders warrant for Douglas and adjoining including Ashland, remove trial from calendar

10:21 AM Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Charles Robert Wohlwend in court. 
Court reviews attorney rights and options.
Defendant- will not be getting attorney
Court finds he has waived attorney rights
State- offer has been rejected, can set for trial
Defendant- didn't make it in writing
Court- will set for trial, parties can continue discussions
Jury trial scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:50 AM Defendant Charles Robert Wohlwend in court and not in-custody.  Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant about getting counsel. Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney.  Defendant is waiving his right to counsel. Court receites charges and possible penalities to Defendant. Court finds Defendant has freely, knowingly, and voluntarily waiving his right to counsel. State will send a Pro Se letter to Defendant.  Status conference scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

01:48 PM Defendant Charles Robert Wohlwend in court.  Mark Adam Fruehauf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's address confirmed.  Court recites charges against defendant and possible penalties.   Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney. Defendant pleads not guilty.   States request on bail: $1000 signature bond with no special conditions
Court Orders $500 signature bond with no special conditions.  Status conference scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
